fields.description:
A feedback from today's demonstration is that it would be very nice if the importer could provide an option to automatically create those projects which are present in the dump file but not in Studio, probably something like this: 

_Question: projects blah blah blah contained in the dump file are not found in Studio. Do you want me to create them for you? <yes> <no>_

People feel that users would love this option.
fields.summary: SVN-Importer: would be nice to have an option to create Studio projects automatically if they are in dump file but not in Studio

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
I submit a request 

Following 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/JIRA+Studio+Plugin+Policy

To use the plugin mentioned as best option in the following page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Copy+Or+Rename+A+Space


My studio instance: http://mmosge.jira.com

Thanks
O

fields.description:
I would like a feature whereby the entire Studio instance could to be exported as a single zip file containing a filesystem folder structure of readable HTML or PDF documents and attachments, 

JIRA studio can be backed up daily, but this only addresses some of the potential risks associated with my company's data.  What happens if contegix or atlassian suddenly goes out of business and I can't access or use the backups?  What if the pipe between the US and AU is down for any length of time due to some disaster, natural or artificial?  And what if we (a medical device company) get audited when this happens?  What if, somehow, all the data is irreversibly corrupted by viruses or malicious intent?

The ultimate fallback is to have old-school hard-copies of every issue/page/file in the system and put those in filing cabinets.  You don't need power or intrnet access to see those files so it's technology-proof (though if that were the situation, we would probably have bigger issues to worry about).  In practice that would take a lot of paper and the manifold issues with hardcopy file systems are why electronic document systems were invented in the first place.

A soft-copy improvement on the filing cabinet system (such as the export suggested) would be achievable though, and would mitigate almost all the risks I stay up at night worrying about.

If a disaster did happen we could then just unzip the file to a local server and grant filesystem access to different folders (= projects/spaces) as we saw fit. Links would be maintained between pages/issues/etc and old versions of wiki pages would still be there (document history is important).  Attachments would be left in their native form. Obviously this exported snapshot would be static/uneditable and we would have to invent some system for any new content but that's not a major problem in such a disaster.

This zip file would be pretty big for most companies, but I'm concerned with risk, not download costs.

This could also possibly be used by companies concerned with meeting 21 CFR Part 11 requirements for electronic record-keeping.
fields.summary: Export entire Studio instance in human-readable form

fields.description:
No function loss has been observed for this but I'd just like to record this observation here.

After successfully importing a dump file, the importer restored the owner/group/permission of the SVN root directory. However, some of the permission bits don't look quite right - there are some "S" bits instead of the "s".
{noformat}
[root@dev1 svn]# find /data/jirastudio/svn/root -maxdepth 1 -ls
9863169    4 drwsrwsr-x   6 apache   js-jira      4096 Dec 23 10:39 /data/jirastudio/svn/root
9863191    4 -rwSrwSr--   1 apache   js-jira       229 Dec 23 10:39 /data/jirastudio/svn/root/README.txt
9863174    4 drwsrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Dec 23 10:39 /data/jirastudio/svn/root/hooks
9863187    4 drwsrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Dec 23 10:39 /data/jirastudio/svn/root/conf
9863170    4 drwsrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Dec 23 10:39 /data/jirastudio/svn/root/locks
9863211    4 -rwSrwSr--   1 apache   js-jira         2 Dec 23 10:39 /data/jirastudio/svn/root/format
9863192    4 drwsrwsr-x   6 apache   js-jira      4096 Dec 23 10:40 /data/jirastudio/svn/root/db
{noformat}

This is how it looks like before the importing:
{noformat}

12779756    4 drwxrwsr-x   7 apache   js-jira      4096 Feb 19  2010 root/
12779797    4 drwxrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Jan 24  2008 root/dav
12779758    4 -rw-rw-r--   1 apache   js-jira       229 Jan 24  2008 root/README.txt
12779806    4 drwxrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Apr 24  2009 root/hooks
12779799    4 drwxrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Jun 22  2008 root/conf
12779791    4 drwxrwsr-x   2 apache   js-jira      4096 Jan 24  2008 root/locks
12779827    4 -r--rw-r--   1 apache   js-jira         2 Feb 19  2010 root/format

{noformat}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description:
There doesn't seem to be a nice hook in studio to hide the 'build' project tab panel when we are in JIRA standalone mode.

The BuildsForProjectTabPanel.java class controls the show/hide status, but this is in the jira-bamboo-plugin component, and uses user permissions to show/hide the panel based on whether the user is a developer or collaborator.

I'm not sure what the nicest way to make this functionality app status aware is.

fields.summary: Fisheye can deadlock in CrowdNotifyServlet

fields.description: Under jroper's initial-data HPT fireball (studio-fireball-2.3-SNAPSHOT-20100929) visiting /source redirects to /secure/views/securitybreach.jsp
fields.summary: FishEye complains of security breach on the initial-data branch

fields.description:
project creation fails working with jroper's initial-data branch on HPT.  

The first potential cause of this is a failure is inability of jira to initiate space creation on <instance>/wiki and repo creation on <instance>/source


This second potential cause of this appears to be due to jira not being able to locate the svn repo root.  We've added the following to the initial properties fed to the app:

{noformat}
svn.base.url=file:///data/jirastudio/apache/home/svn/root
svn.public.url=http://hpt-testing-003.jira.com/svn
studio.svn.base.url=file:///data/jirastudio/apache/home/svn/root
studio.svn.public.url=http://hpt-testing-003.jira.com/svn
{noformat}

redundant of course, but I wanted to make sure it wasn't something silly.
fields.summary: Project creation fails in the initial-data branch

fields.description:
Currently, end users (without the super system admin access) can not navigate to the admin pages to manage the Gliffy plugin for Confluence and Balsamiq plugin for JIRA and Confluence.

However, end users can manage the Gliffy Plugin for JIRA themselves via Admin > Issues > System > Gliffy Plugin for JIRA License

End users can access the admin pages themselves directly via the URL - eg <server>/wiki/admin/plugin-repository/gliffypluginadmin.action

As users can purchase the plugin or may wish to generate evaluation licenses from our plugin vendors directly, it would be helpful if they can navigate to the admin pages of these plugins via the admin console rather than forcing them to raise a support request.

Also, there are some configuration options which the end user may want to change in addition to updating the license key (eg, 'Gliffy editor opens in own window' option for Gliffy for Confluence).
fields.summary: Users can not navigate to the Balsamiq plugin (JIRA and Confluence) and Gliffy plugin (for Confluence) admin pages

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
It would be nice to have the survey macro (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/195) available in Jira Studio.
fields.summary: Survey macro

fields.description:
Currently the 'Request Support' link in the footer adds a bunch of parameters:
https://support.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?summary=Your+summary+here...&issuetype=1&priority=3&description=Please+describe+your+problem+here%3A%0A%0A%0AProblem+reported+from+URL%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fstudio.atlassian.com%2Fsecure%2FCreateIssue.jspa%3Fpid%3D10073%26issuetype%3D4&customfield_10440=https%3A%2F%2Fstudio.atlassian.com&pid=10140&

We'd actually prefer it go here:
https://support.atlassian.com/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa

That way, users can select their issue type, which is an important part of our workflow. We'll send things to different places and add different priorities for different kinds of issues. 

The primary casualty is the "Hosted Product URL" field, which looks like it's getting populated from the "Problem Reported from URL" parameter. Can we continue to pass that parameter through the HTTP Request? If we need to make a modification to SAC to continue to maintain that parameter in the HTTPRequest, maybe we can figure out a way to do that.
fields.summary: Request Support link in footer should allow Issue Type Selection

fields.description:
AppStatusUtil is a utility class for integration tests, which provides utility methods to assist in enabling/disabling apps and switching between JIRA Studio mode and standalone modes. It acts as a client to AppStatusControllerServlet, which is redundant in light of the equivalent REST service.

This was requested in review CR-AOD-322 (https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-322#c27736).
fields.summary: AppStatusUtil should use the AppStatus REST service rather than the AppStatus Servlet

fields.description:
Prior to the Dec 5th update, things were working fine.

Today if I log onto jacits.jira.com (as any user), click on the upper left and try to navigate to the personal space (the link being http://jacits.jira.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/personalspace)

The result is this page:
**********************************
Page Not Found

The page you were trying to reach could not be found. This could be because:

The page does not exist.
The page exists, but you do not have permission to view it.
Site Search

Go to
Site Homepage
Your Dashboard
************************************

If I then navigate to 'your dashboard'--> spaces --> 'My'

I am then at the page (https://jacits.jira.com/wiki/dashboard.action?spacesSelectedTab=my)

PROBLEMS:
but then my company logo is gone (replaced by https://jacits.jira.com/wiki/images/logo/confluence_48_white.png)

if I'm logged in as the administrator at this time I also have no access to our jira studio 'administration' menu item.


(it seems like I'm in a purely 'confluence' instance at this point and have no way back to the 'studio' environment)
fields.summary: Personal Space links broken since Dec 5th confluence update

fields.description:

This will be much faster than deploying from developer machines because the fireball will be copied between contegix machines (BEAC -> dev2.jira.com).
